pullRequest.body:
The idea of this recursion principle is that you can build an ordinal by adding one power of `b` at a time, as long as `1 < b â‰¤ Ï‰`.

### PR summary [408b84e787](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15991/commits/408b84e7871bac7b17c6070b7a21514abf0c34d2)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CNFRec'`
`+ CNFRec'_pos`
`+ CNFRec'_zero`
`+ add_sub_cancel_opow_log`
`+ lt_add_right_of_lt_mul_omega0`
`+ sub_opow_log_lt`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
Is it not possible to consider eveery instance of `b ^ a` separately for a general base `b`?

Not for a general base, you need a `2 â‰¤ b â‰¤ Ï‰` assumption (e.g. you can't write Ï‰ as a finite sum of powers of Ï‰ + 1). I guess I could generalize this and add a `two_le_omega` lemma to make this inductive lemma as straightforward as possible in the intended `Ï‰` case.
I've revamped this PR with said generalization.

```suggestion
noncomputable def CNFRecOmega {C : Ordinal â†’ Sort*} (H0 : C 0)
```
or
```suggestion
noncomputable def CNFOmegaRec {C : Ordinal â†’ Sort*} (H0 : C 0)
```

Per the naming conventions, this and the def above should be `cnfrec` or perhaps `cnfRec` or `recCNF`. To avoid deprecating your new name as soon as its introduced, can you make a PR to fix the existing name first?

pullRequest.title: feat(SetTheory/Ordinal/CantorNormalForm): alternate CNF recursion principle
